alert.note: Alert for Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:11AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Logan, Newton, Johnson, southwestern Boone and northwestern Pope Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 910 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Aurora to Pettigrew to 8 miles south of Boston to 7 miles northeast of Wiederkehr Village to near Denning. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Clarksville... Paris... Jasper... Lamar... Dover... London... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Carver... Erbie... Moore... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Lost Valley State Park... Pruitt... Taral... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
